intro: Laserpitium pubescens, commonly known as the hairy eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has a compact, bushy habit. Its name derives from the hairy texture of its stems and leaves, which are covered in fine pubescence. Laserpitium pubescens is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
